title: Analyst (Arbitrage Rebate)
description:
The arbitrage rebate analyst works within the firm's Financial Analysis & Services group ("FAS"). FAS consists of non-attorney professionals working under the purview of the firm's tax department.

The primary role of the analyst is to prepare various financial analyses and calculations relating to bond financings to ensure compliance with certain federal tax laws and regulations. Certain projects relating to "arbitrage" entail gathering historical investment information and analyzing such information using Excel spreadsheets to determine optimal investment returns.

The analyst prepares reports using Word and Excel which include a summary of all assumptions and methodologies and the calculations for municipal bonds. Other projects may include developing and refining financial models, preparing yield calculations, loan amortization schedules, cash flow analyses, swap/hedge analysis, presentations, marketing materials, and research.

The arbitrage rebate analyst position requires an undergraduate degree, preferably in finance, economics, mathematics, statistics or other technical fields. Knowledge of fixed income securities (especially municipal bonds), accounting and general financial market terminology is preferred. Strong working knowledge of Excel and Word. Strong verbal and written communication skills. Detail-oriented with excellent organization skills. Salary is $50,000-$60,000 plus performance bonus.

**Interested applicants should apply at: https://www.hawkins.com/careers. Please include a cover letter, resume, transcript and writing sample.**

Hawkins is an equal opportunity employer, committed to a work environment in which all individuals are treated with respect and dignity. We believe that diversity is vital to the firm’s ability to provide our clients with the highest level of service. The firm prohibits discrimination or harassment based upon race, color, religion, gender, age, national origin, citizenship status, disability, marital or partnership status, sexual orientation, actual or perceived gender and gender identity, veteran's status or any other legally protected status. This policy pertains to every aspect of an individual's relationship with the firm, including recruitment, hiring, compensation, benefits, training and development, promotion, transfer, discipline, termination, and all other privileges, terms and conditions of employment.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $50,000.00 - $60,000.00 per year

Experience:

* Accounting: 1 year (Preferred)
* Microsoft Excel: 1 year (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

* New York, NY 10007 (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* New York, NY 10007: Relocate before starting work (Preferred)

Work Location: Hybrid remote in New York, NY 10007

title: QA Specialist
description:
We are looking for an QA Specialist!!

**POSITION DESCRIPTION**:

We are looking for a detail-oriented quality assurance specialist to maintain QA audits and records to ensure the organization’s quality assurance standards and procedures are met. The quality assurance specialists responsibilities include conducting reviews of patient charts to ensure they comply with the company’s QA standards, identifying issues in the chart and with processes and procedures, and presenting solutions. The quality assurance specialist will also assist in preparing medical records and writing appeal letters. Salary commensurate with experience. We are interested in RN's and LCSW, LMHC, MSW ( Therapist). Entry levels are also welcome to apply.

**POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Perform internal audits of staff documentation and programs/levels of care and report on the accuracy, timeliness, and content of the information documented in the patient’s chart.
* Submit deficiencies to appropriate staff and supervisors.
* Perform quality assurance checks of patient charts to ensure medical necessity is being met and that documentation supports reimbursement accuracy.
* Interpret quality assurance standards to ensure quality care to patients by department
* and/or organization wide.
* Document quality assurance activities and audits.
* Collaborate with the medical records department in reviewing patient medical records and utilize clinical and regulatory knowledge and skills along with payer requirements.
* Remain current on regulatory best practices policies, as well as with ongoing compliance issues, provide feedback to appropriate personnel.
* Stay well-informed of industry changes and regulations to ensure adherence and proactive preparedness.
* Administrative tasks such as answering requests for medical records, printing, faxing, and scanning.
* Knowledge of HIPAA, state, and federal confidentiality laws regarding substance abuse and mental health patients and records.
* Ensuring appropriate release of information is on file prior to releasing records.

**POSITION REQUIREMENTS**:

* High school diploma/GED required
* Degree/Certification preferred (LPN, RN, Clinical, Coding, or other related degree) but not required; will consider experience in place of degree.
* Previous experience in quality assurance, compliance, medical records, or a similar field.
* Working knowledge of levels of care, regulatory standards, and concepts of quality assurance as it relates to the documentation of substance abuse and mental health treatment records
* Adaptable, able to perform multiple working tasks at a time when needed.
* Critical thinker, able to conceptualize, apply, analyze, and evaluate information gathered as a guide to validate audit results and correct as necessary.

**KEY SKILLS**:

* Excellent data collection and analysis skills
* High standards of quality, attention to detail, and organization
* Proactive and self-directed
* Ability to work with a team
* Outstanding verbal and written communication skills

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Ability to Relocate:

* Mountainside, NJ: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Junior Supply Chain Consultant - September 2025
description:
### **Who are we?**

  

We're Bluecrux. Pleased to meet you! Founded in 2011, Bluecrux is a value chain consulting and technology company. Our experts and software solutions help to transform today’s supply chains into smart, efficient, and fully integrated value chains. We believe that only true collaboration leads to innovation by converging at the intersection of our knowledge and our customers’ ambition and linking expertise with technology and problems with solutions. We’re a community, a movement that’s built at this intersection which we call “the Cutting X”: it’s where supply chains evolve, and value chains are forged.

  

Our client portfolio includes some of the world's largest companies, including Johnson & Johnson, GSK, Roche, Bridgestone, Oatly, and many more. Our desire to work closely with them is also reflected in our global presence, with offices in Europe, the US, and APAC.

### **What will you be doing?**

  

* You'll start immediately in a visible, autonomous role as a project member of one of our running value chain projects within different industries such as life sciences, chemicals, food & beverages, and manufacturing.
* You'll see yourself working on and contributing to the main project phases. Here's an idea of what to expect:
	+ In general, you'll play a key role in analyzing, mapping, and conducting existing business processes in Supply Chain and Operations. To refine your analysis, you will also prepare and run project interviews to better understand the client's needs. You'll become aware of the customer organization and be part of driving change in their organization and ways of working.
	+ You'll track KPIs and report and present them accurately to the customer project team.
	+ You are responsible for the qualitative documentation of all your project tasks. You'll contribute to delivering the most important customer and project deliverables, such as meeting notes, playbooks, and training materials.
 **Is it you that we're looking for?**

  

* **Educational Background:** You hold a degree in business engineering, civil engineering, operational research, applied economics, or a related field, with a strong understanding of Supply Chain Processes gained through formal education or relevant coursework (e.g., minor or major, MBA program).
* **Supply Chain Interest:** You demonstrate a keen interest or initial experience in supply chain processes, with a passion for optimizing supply chain performance.
* **Analytical Skills:** You possess exceptional analytical and problem-solving abilities, enabling you to dissect complex supply chain issues and develop effective solutions.
* **Team Collaboration:** You excel in both independent and team settings, displaying strong collaboration skills and the ability to communicate effectively with team members and stakeholders at all levels.
* **Adaptability and Resilience:** You thrive in a fast-paced environment, demonstrating adaptability and resilience in tackling daily challenges and changing project requirements.
* **Continuous Improvement:** You are open to feedback, committed to self-improvement, and proactive in seeking opportunities for growth and development.
* **Technical Proficiency:** You have a strong aptitude for working with technical tools and software and are comfortable learning new technologies.
* **Project Management:** You have strong project management skills, including the ability to manage timelines, deliverables, and client expectations effectively.
* **Customer Focus:** You are dedicated to delivering exceptional customer service, understanding client needs, and ensuring their satisfaction with our solutions.
* **Willingness to Travel:** You are willing to travel, as projects may take place at clients' offices across the U.S. and potentially worldwide, providing a dynamic and varied work experience.

### **What you'll love about working for us...**

* **Dynamic Team Environment:** Join a team that passionately lives Bluecrux's values every day. Experience a supportive, motivated work culture.
* **Growth and Development:** Take initiative and grow with us. We provide ample opportunities to enhance both your personal and professional skills while encouraging you to be your authentic self.
* **Career Advancement:** Thrive in a workplace that offers numerous growth opportunities. We prioritize your personal and professional development and ensure there's always room for innovation and individuality.
* **Inclusive and Friendly Culture:** We value each team member's contributions and recognize you by your first name. Our culture breaks down barriers and focuses on your unique talents.
* **Engaging Team Activities:** Enjoy a variety of team events, including annual Bluecrux weekends, monthly last-Friday gatherings with drinks, team-building exercises, and other fun activities.
* **Outstanding Benefits Package:** Benefit from a competitive compensation package that includes:
	+ Competitive base salary
	+ Annual performance-based bonus
	+ 12 holidays and 26 days of Paid Time Off (PTO)
	+ Company closure between Christmas and New Year's
	+ Highly competitive health insurance, effective on your first day, with 100% of the employee's premium paid by Bluecrux and 50% of premiums for dependents covered
	+ Competitive dental and vision insurance coverage
	+ Basic life insurance at no cost, with additional coverage available for purchase
	+ Voluntary accident insurance and critical illness insurance to complement medical coverage
	+ Health Care Flexible Spending Account (FSA)
	+ Company-covered cell phone
	+ 401(k) plan with fixed employer contributions

title: Fire & Life Safety Director (FLSD) F89 or T89 License Needed
description:
**Fire & Life Safety Director (FLSD) F89 or T89 License Security Guard**

Available Shifts **- Saturday and Sunday 7PM to 7AM** 

**Duties:** The fire safety director's main mission is to protect life and property. This means planning, developing, implementing and monitoring a fire safety plan that addresses specific fire and life safety systems. To do this properly, the director must know current fire safety code for properties, buildings and other structures.

**Responsibilities:** The fire director must see to it that emergency procedures are in place for every building or property so that occupants know what to do and where to go in the event of an emergency. The fire director must ensure that plans are adequate and well-developed for safe and timely evacuations and emergency response. The director is also responsible for working with local fire departments and emergency responders to solicit input and support in creating a solid, workable response plan.

**Other Responsibilities:**

· Performs security patrols.

· Responsible for the safety and security of the hotel guest, employees, and property.

· Secures premises and personnel by patrolling property; monitoring surveillance equipment; inspecting buildings, equipment, and access points.

· Prevents losses and damage by reporting irregularities, informing violators of policy and procedures.

· Completes reports by recording observations, information, occurrences, and surveillance activities, obtaining signatures.

· Maintains environment by monitoring and setting building and equipment controls.

· Maintains organization's stability and reputation by complying with legal requirements.

· Contributes to team effort by accomplishing any ad hoc tasks necessary.

**Education and Training Requirements:**

* High school diploma or GED equivalent
* Knowledge and skill in operation of radio communications equipment
* Knowledge of computerized security alarm systems & Fire Panels
* Fire Director must have a NY State Security License & F-89/T89 License
* Ability to communicate effectively both orally and written
* Maintain company professional standards

title: Private Markets Fundraising Analyst/Associate
description:
Summary:
Neuberger Berman is an employee-owned global investment management firm with $474 billion in assets under management. The private equity group of the firm, NB Private Markets, is a leading and growing investor in private markets, managing over $115 billion of client commitments since inception. The Secondary Investment group within NB Private Markets consists of approximately $19 billion in assets under management. The Secondary team purchases seasoned private equity investments from investors desiring liquidity through both traditional secondary transactions as well as GP-led secondaries.
The Secondary Fundraising/Marketing team within NB Private Markets is focused on developing and implementing the fundraising strategy for the Secondary team. The group plays a key role across the full lifecycle of the Secondary funds from formation to fundraising to managing communications with investors.  

The team is seeking a junior team member (analyst or associate) dedicated to the Secondary team to help manage non-investment activities for the team. The individual will work closely with the investment, marketing, sales, legal, finance and operations teams to meet the needs of investors and prospects.
The individual will have a wide scope of responsibilities as outlined below.
Responsibilities:* Assist in managing fundraising processes
	+ Liaise with portfolio managers and sales force, legal, finance, and operations teams to deliver materials and respond to requests for proposals (“RfPs”), manage prospect follow-ups, as well as answer client/prospect inquiries
	+ Manage fundraising activity across distribution channels
	+ Manage capital formation activities, such as drafting legal documents, launching datarooms and creating marketing materials
	+ Update fund marketing materials and other ongoing prospect communications
	+ Provide sales with tools that they need, such as content, customized materials and education of the product
	+ Work closely with investment teams to provide communication and updates internally and externally during fundraising processes
	+ Perform quantitative analyses and research
	+ Serve as a resource for the broader Neuberger Berman sales teams for Secondary related matters
	+ Handle logistics related to closing including coordination with sales, legal, subscription and clients
	+ Organize and coordinate onsite meetings for clients
* Manage Secondary platform data
	+ Track and maintain LP commitment data
	+ Track investment activity and performance across products
* Help manage public exposure through our annual meeting, industry conferences, databases and seminars


Qualifications:* Undergraduate degree in economics or finance
* At least 1-2 years of relevant professional experience for an analyst and 3-4 years for an associate (i.e., experience with investment banking, secondary firm, placement agent or consulting)
* Excellent academic credentials
* Ability to multi-task, team-player attitude and a desire to work on a wide range of projects and manage them effectively
* Strong organizational skills
* Remarkable attention to detail
* Strong judgment, maturity and critical thinking skills
* Excellent communication, and ability to articulate and present ideas effectively both orally and in written form
* Initiative and creativity in approach to problem solving and to be resourceful
* Exhibits strong dedication to the job and takes ownership of deliverables
* Initiative and creativity in approach to problem solving
* Ability to move quickly up the learning curve

Compensation Details
The salary range for this role is $100,000-$140,000. This is the lowest to highest salary we in good faith believe we would pay for this role at the time of this posting. We may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range, and the range may be modified in the future. This range is only applicable for jobs to be performed in New York City. An employee’s pay position within the salary range will be based on several factors including, but limited to, relevant education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, seniority, geographic location, performance, shift, travel requirements, sales or revenue-based metrics, any collective bargaining agreements, and business or organizational needs. This job is also eligible for a discretionary bonus. We offer a comprehensive package of benefits including paid time off, medical/dental/vision insurance, 401(k), life insurance and other benefits to eligible employees.
Note: No amount of pay is considered to be wages or compensation until such amount is earned, vested, and determinable. The amount and availability of any bonus, commission, production, or any other form of compensation that are allocable to a particular employee remains in the Company's sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified at the Company’s sole discretion, consistent with the law.*Neuberger Berman is an equal* *opportunity/affirmative* *action employer. The Firm and its affiliates do not discriminate in employment because of race, creed, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship status or protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by local, state, or federal laws, rules, or regulations. If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please contact* *onlineaccommodations@nb.com**.**Learn about the* *Applicant Privacy Notice**.*

title: Ballet Teacher

Implement safety protocols during practices and performances to prevent injuries and accidents.

Proficiency in ballet and ballet techniques, with a strong background in dance education and teaching.

Prior experience as a ballet dance teacher or instructor is preferred.

Ability to create original and visually appealing dance routines.

Strong leadership and motivational skills to inspire and guide the dance team to success.

Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to interact with team members, parents, and administrators.

Effective time management and organizational skills to coordinate practices, events, and administrative tasks.

Knowledge of safety practices to ensure the well-being of team members during practices and performances.

Dance Teachers plays a vital role in shaping the skills, discipline, and teamwork of the dance team, helping them achieve their best performances on stage and in competitions.

title: Ride Maintenance Technician
description:
Thursday, September 26th, 2024
  
10:00 AM to 4:00 PM
  
  

**LOCATION:** RECRUITING CENTER AT AMERICAN DREAM
  
(Parking deck A, 2nd Floor, across from Hasbro Gameroom near Five Guys)
  
  

American Dream, developed by Triple Five Group, is an unparalleled mix of world-class entertainment, retail, and dining, comprising more than 3 million square feet just minutes away from New York City in East Rutherford, New Jersey. American Dream is home to leading attractions, including DreamWorks Water Park, Nickelodeon Universe Theme Park, LEGOLAND Discovery Center, SEA LIFE Aquarium, Big SNOW Ski Hill, Dream Wheel – a 300-foot observation wheel overlook the NYC skyline, as well as attractions debuting soon such as The Game Room Powered by Hasbro and Skip Barber Racing Go-Kart Academy. American Dream’s immersive luxury shopping and dining experience – The Avenue – features Saks Fifth Avenue, Hermès, Saint Laurent, Dolce & Gabbana, Carpaccio, a fine-dining Italian restaurant, and much more. The retail collection is further expanded with flagship locations for Aritzia, H&M, PRIMARK, Uniqlo, Sephora and Zara; as well as the Toys'R'Us global flagship, the only standalone location in the U.S, and the world’s first and only “candy department store,” IT’SUGAR.
  
  

For more information on American Dream, visit www.americandream.com or find us on Instagram @americandream and TikTok @americandream\\_official.
  
  

KEY OBJECTIVE(S)
  
  

**The main purpose of the Rides Maintenance Tech II is:**  

* Ensure safe and efficient operation of rides and equipment during new installations, scheduled maintenance or unscheduled maintenance in the Amusement Park and Water Park.


PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES
  
  

* Perform new equipment installations in compliance with all applicable standards.
* Complete ride opening inspections and repairs as assigned.
* Maintain knowledge of repairs and maintenance to all rides.
* Respond to trouble calls in a timely and professional manner.
* Complete and maintain all required documentation.
* Maintain and repair equipment and facilities within Nickelodeon Universe.
* Ensure the overall safety of the immediate work area as well as surrounding areas.
* Provide outstanding internal and external guest service at all times.
* Exercise effective use of parts and supplies.
* Participate in capital and special event projects throughout the year.
* Properly document and communicate relevant information and problems.
* Maintain effective and professional communication with management and co-workers.
* Assist in training of new employees.
* Provide information and research for parts, equipment and vendors.
* Perform all other duties as assigned.


DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS
  
  

* 2-year technical degree in a mechanical/electrical field.
* 5+ years of related experience.
* Practical knowledge of principles and practices of the maintenance or construction field.
* Expert knowledge in one or more of the following disciplines: electrical, pneumatics, fabricating, mechanical, hydraulics, welding, machining, and electronics.
* Previous knowledge and safe use of a variety of related electrical equipment and/or tools preferred.
* Current Level 1 certification from a nationally recognized safety organization (AIMS, NAARSO, etc.) preferred or willingness to take examination and pass.
* Proficient oral and written communication required.
* Practical knowledge of Programmable Logic Controllers (PLCs)
* Working knowledge of Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) protocols and comfort working at height.


PHYSICAL JOB REQUIREMENTS
  
  

* Perform repetitive motion- infrequently 10% of time
* Stand - frequently 90% of time
* Walk - frequently 90% of time
* Sit – 10% of the time
* Reach at, or above shoulder level- frequently 50% of time.
* Reach at or below shoulder level 50% of the time
* Kneel and bend- frequently 50% of time
* Stoop/squat- frequently 50% of time
* Push and Pull – 15% of the time
* Climb stairs and ladders 20% of the time
* Lift/Carry between 10-75 lbs. occasionally 25% of time
* Able to work at heights between 35-200 ft infrequently 30 % of time

All employment decisions are to be made without regard to race, color, age, gender, sexual orientation, religion, marital status, pregnancy, national origin/ancestry, citizenship, physical/mental disability, military status, or any other basis prohibited by law.

title: AWS, DevOps, Python Application Developer
description:
**Accenture Flex** offers you the flexibility of local fixed-duration project-based work powered by Accenture, a leading global professional services company. Accenture is consistently recognized on FORTUNE's 100 Best Companies to Work For and Diversity Inc's Top 50 Companies For Diversity lists.


As an **Accenture Flex** employee, you will apply your skills and experience to help drive business transformation for leading organizations and communities. In addition to delivering innovative solutions for Accenture's clients, you will work with a highly skilled, diverse network of people across Accenture businesses who are using the latest emerging technologies to address today's biggest business challenges.

**Key Responsibilities:**


You will receive competitive rewards and access to benefits programs and world-class learning resources. **Accenture Flex** employees work in their local metro area onsite at the project, significantly reducing and/or eliminating the demands to travel.

* Knowledge of AWS and its associated technologies, both from DevOps and CloudOps perspective
* Knowledge of Amazon ECS Cloud instances and configuration
* Creating S3 buckets and manage IAM rule based policies
* Design and manage highly scalable/available Cloud Infrastructure
* Extensive knowledge of Terraform and infrastructure as code
* Extensive knowledge of CI/CD tools and configuration of build and release pipelines
* Working with version control tools such as Bitbucket or GitHub
* Perform Patch management tasks include: maintaining current knowledge of available patches, deciding what patches are appropriate for particular systems, ensuring that patches are installed properly, testing systems after installation, and documenting all associated procedures
* Recommend and implement system enhancements that will improve the performance and reliability of the system including installing, upgrading/patching, monitoring, problem resolution, and configuration management.
* Test new releases of products to ensure compatibility and minimize user impact

  

**Basic Qualifications:**

* Minimum 5 Years DevOps
* Minimum 5 Years AWS
* Minimum 5 Years Python

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Good Communication
* Client facing experience in a team set up
* Banking experience

title: Network Operations Practitioner - 5342327
description:
**Accenture Flex** offers you the flexibility of local fixed-duration project-based work powered by Accenture, a leading global professional services company. Accenture is consistently recognized on FORTUNE's 100 Best Companies to Work For and Diversity Inc's Top 50 Companies For Diversity lists.


As an **Accenture Flex** employee, you will apply your skills and experience to help drive business transformation for leading organizations and communities. In addition to delivering innovative solutions for Accenture's clients, you will work with a highly skilled, diverse network of people across Accenture businesses who are using the latest emerging technologies to address today's biggest business challenges.


You will receive competitive rewards and access to benefits programs and world-class learning resources. **Accenture Flex** employees work in their local metro area onsite at the project, significantly reducing and/or eliminating the demands to travel.


You will be part of a vital team responsible for the ongoing support and maintenance of network infrastructure primarily consisting of Cisco and Aruba network devices, including routers, switches, and wireless access points. This position's primary role is to install, operate and maintain network devices and to mitigate network outages and performance issues. This team is first to take appropriate action to resolve network and system problems as they appear. We detect, analyze, and resolve network LAN/WAN and transmission system problems while minimizing impact on the business. We differentiate between primary and secondary network failures. Based on the severity or type of event, we identify and engage additional resources as required. We are responsible for remotely supporting installation of various IT hardware equipment and bringing systems "on-line". This role is part of a team that is required to support client infrastructure 24x7x365 and adhere to SLA requirements for responsiveness and resolution times.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Configure, install, and troubleshoot various network devices and services (e.g., routers, switches, wireless, voice, DNS, DCHP, NAC) across multiple client sites.
* Manage and resolve issues related to Cisco/Aruba switches and wireless access devices.
* Monitor performance and ensure system availability and reliability. Work within established configuration and change management policies to ensure awareness, approval and success of changes made to the network infrastructure.
* Perform network maintenance and system upgrades.
* Liaise with vendors and other IT personnel for problem resolution.
* Ensure strict adherence to SLA requirements for responsiveness and resolution.
* Utilize Network Management systems and tools for monitoring and troubleshooting.
* Participate in an on-call rotation and respond to emergency network issues.

  

**Basic Qualifications:**

* Minimum 3 years of experience in configurations, installs, and troubleshooting various network devices and services e.g., routers, switches, wireless, voice, DNS, DCHP, NAC across multiple client sites.
* Minimum 3 years of experience in managing and resolving issues related to Cisco Aruba switches and wireless access devices. Monitor performance and ensure system availability and reliability
* High School Diploma or GED

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* CCNA
* Cisco Certified Network Associate

**Job Summary**
---------------

  

**Summary:** Cuts delicatessen meats, vegetables and cheeses with slicing machine, knives or other cutters. Prepares and serves sandwiches, salads and other cold food items.
  

  

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Obtains daily production schedule and preparation requirements from Chef.
* Prepares sandwich meats, cheeses, condiments and salads using approved production standards to ensure proper quality, serving temperatures and standard portion control.
* Stocks and replenishes deli/cold products and condiments following approved merchandising guidelines.
* Carries pans, kettles and trays of food to and from workstation, stove and refrigerator.
* Stores food in designated areas following HACCP standard wrapping, dating and rotation procedures.
* Cleans, sanitizes and maintains counters, work surfaces, refrigeration units and floors in the preparation and serving areas.
* Places meat, cheese or vegetables on cutting board and cuts slices to designated thickness. Positions and clamps meat or cheese on carriage of slicing machine. Adjusts knob to set machine for desired thickness. Presses button to start motor that moves carriage past rotary blade that slices meats and cheeses.
* Interacts with coworkers to ensure compliance with company service standards, inventory and cash control procedures.
* Maintains clean, safe work environment to comply with sanitation, ServSafe and safety requirements.
* Performs other duties as assigned.

title: Superintendent
description:
Seeking an experienced, working superintendent to work with a team of superintendents for a large Mitchell Lama Coop (7 buildings, 1750+ unit complex) in Far Rockaway, Queens. This position is a live in, 32BJ Union position and comes with a Two (2) bedroom apartment.

**\\*If you have less than 5 years of fulltime superintendent experience and working with large staff , do not apply:**

Minimum of five (5) years of experience supervising building operations and large maintenance staff.

* Strong supervisory skills with the ability to manage approximately 40 building employees.
* Supervise and direct all cleaning, maintenance, and, onsite staff in day-to-day operations and perform daily property condition inspections to ensure all common areas are properly maintained and clean.
* Interact heavily with and provide exceptional service to our residents by handling all resident maintenance requests and following up and tracking open tickets.
* Perform move-in, move-out, and turnover inspections.
* Conduct Regular preventive maintenance throughout the property to include both interior and exterior.
* Provide overall leadership of facility maintenance, including planning, developing, and preforming preventative and routine maintenance schedules.
* Submit incident reports to management regarding emergencies, resident incidents, staffing incidents, unsafe conditions, etc.
* Advise management on maintenance issues and projects as requested.
* Complete repair work and projects in a timely manner. Where possible, oversees staff/contractors. Where necessary, self-perform repair work.
* Proficiently skilled in plumbing, electrical, mechanical, and basic construction. Ensure that all mechanical infrastructure systems, electric, ventilation, and pool operation are well maintained.
* Work with outside agencies such as Fire Department of New York (FDNY), Department of Buildings (DOB), and Housing Preservation and Development (HPD) departments, to ensure compliance with all local, state and federal regulations related to facilities and grounds.
* Knowledge of building operation and fire safety codes and regulation required.
* Knowledge of budget management, building security, HPD codes and regulations strongly desired.
* Ability to work jointly with the security team.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* Solid computer skills with knowledge of Microsoft Word and Excel.
* Driver’s License required.

title: Corporate Counsel, Contracts (Hybrid)
description:
**Company Description**  

SGS is the global leader and innovator in inspection, verification, testing and certification services. Founded in 1878, SGS is recognized as the global benchmark in quality and integrity. With over 97,000 employees in 130 countries and operating a network of more than 2,400 offices and laboratories, we provide services to almost every industry by assuring quality and safety of products and services.  

  

Trusted all over the world, SGS is a market leader because we put 100% passion, pride and innovation into everything we do. We encourage new ideas. We welcome people who challenge the way we do things. And we will be 100% committed to helping you reach your full potential.

 **Job Description**  

The **Corporate Counsel, Contracts** (North American Market) reviews, drafts and negotiates a wide variety of commercial contracts. They provide advanced and independent legal advice, prepares contracts, represents business interests in contract negotiations, and supports legal team in other related matters.

**Hybrid Schedule**

* Independently drafts, reviews, negotiates both customer and supplier agreements, real estate leases, software licenses, purchase, sales, insurance contacts, etc.
* Ensures that contracts are in compliance with legal, regulatory and company policies.
* Conducts legal, regulatory, and business-related research and reviews various agreements and documents.
* Acts as escalation point for Paralegals who have contract questions or issues.
* Participates in special projects where the experience, ability, or expertise of the attorney merits involvement.
* Adheres to internal standards, policies, and procedures.
* Performs other duties as assigned.

  

**Qualifications** **Education and Experience**

* J.D. degree from accredited law school and admission to NJ bar or eligibility for NJ In-house counsel license
* 3 to 7 years as a practicing attorney, preferably with both private and in house legal practice experience
* Direct knowledge of and experience in commercial contracting and legal concepts related thereto.

**Licenses and Certifications**

* Licensed to practice law in New Jersey or at least one state within the United States and an attorney in good standing in such jurisdiction with the ability to obtain a NJ in-house counsel designation

**Knowledge/Skills/Abilities**

* Language Skills: English – Advanced level
* Mathematical Skills: Basic level
* Reasoning Skills/Abilities: Advanced level
* Analytical, problem solving, interpersonal, negotiation and legal reasoning skills
* Ability to work effectively and efficiently with others and coordinate a variety of internal and external activities having legal significance to the Company
* Ability to manage issues and workload independently with minimal supervision
* Excellent oral and written communication skills
* Strong organizational skills

**Computer Skills**

* MS Office (Word, Excel) – Intermediate user proficiency

**Benefits**

* Salary - $100,000-$130,000 based on experience

  

**Additional Information**  

SGS is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and as such we recruit, hire, train, and promote persons in all job classifications without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetics, status as a protected veteran, or any other characteristics protected by law.


To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily with or without reasonable accommodations. The requirements listed above are representative of the knowledge, skills, and/or abilities required.


This job description should not be construed as an exhaustive statement of duties, responsibilities or requirements, but a general description of the job. Nothing contained herein restricts the company’s rights to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.

You will receive a call back. title: Corporate Vice President, Institutional Life Actuarial Analytics Lead
description:
**Location Designation:** Hybrid - 3 days per week

  

Join Corporate Finance where expertise meets strategic impact. Partner with diverse business units, providing financial insights and guiding sound decision-making. You'll work collaboratively to ensure data accuracy, implement robust controls, and safeguard policy owner interests. Become part of a team dedicated to financial stewardship, enabling business performance, and paving the way for a secure future for generations to come.

  



**Role Overview:**


Institutional Life (IL) is looking for an actuarial lead who will be in charge of actuarial analytics and modeling oversight to support new product development, inforce management, and regulatory compliance for the business. The IL pricing team is nimble in actions and closely integrated with the business; this role will have direct exposure to senior Institutional Life finance/business leaders and a wide range of functions, providing for a unique holistic experience into real time business management. This is a hybrid on-site role located in NYC Home Office and reports to the Head of Institutional Life Pricing.

  



**What You’ll Do:**

* Responsible for financial analytics on BOLI and COLI businesses, including Value of New Business reporting and inforce analyses
* Manage Prophet model architecture and periodic updates across new business and inforce BOLI/COLI products to ensure the integrity, accuracy and timeliness of Institutional Life modeling capabilities
* Have the opportunity to lead special cross-functional financial analyses to evaluate regulatory requirements, optimize inforce economics and support decision-making on business management; examples include but are not limited to reinsurance economic analysis, assumption development, Non-Guaranteed Element attestation and Disciplined Current Scale assessment, etc.
* Support dynamic customized case pricing requests to provide tailored design solutions to meet the various needs of institutional clients, on both new sales and inforce
* Stay abreast of changes in the regulatory environment that may impact product development/design decisions
* Manage 1 to 2 direct reports

 **What You’ll Bring****:**

* FSA with Prophet model experience; prior pricing experience a plus
* Ability to handle multiple tasks and deal with shifting priorities all within tight timelines
* Strong people management and project management skills
* Ability to flourish under ambiguity and learn on-the-job, with a continuous improvement mindset
* Self-starter with strong analytical skills and attention to detail
* Ability to think outside the box and open-mindedness to innovative and creative solutions
* Strong written and oral communication skills, including the ability to communicate to a wide range of stakeholders with different backgrounds
* Excellent interpersonal and business partnering skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively across organizations and influence decision-making

  



**Pay Transparency**


Salary Range: $122,500-$210,000


Overtime eligible: Exempt


Discretionary bonus eligible: Yes


Sales bonus eligible: No

  

Actual base salary will be determined based on several factors but not limited to individual’s experience, skills, qualifications, and job location. Additionally, employees are eligible for an annual discretionary bonus. In addition to base salary, employees may also be eligible to participate in an incentive program.

 **Our Benefits**


We provide a full package of benefits for employees – and have unique offerings for a modern workforce, including leave programs, adoption assistance, and student loan repayment programs. Based on feedback from our employees, we continue to refine and add benefits to our offering, so that you can flourish both inside and outside of work.Click hereto discover more about our comprehensive benefit options or visit our NYL Benefits Site.

  



**Our Diversity Promise**


We believe in a diverse workforce because it is our mission to advocate for the financial security and success of people in every community. This is why diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) are guiding principles that are embedded in our brand and our culture. Click here to learn more about how we have been recognized for our leadership.

We're proud that due to our mutuality, we operate in the best interests of our policy owners. title: Manager - Pension Risk Transfer Annuity Operations and Service
description:
**Location Designation:** Hybrid - 3 days per week

 **This position primarily involves a hybrid work schedule - working remotely: Monday & Friday / on site: Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday.**

  

At Institutional Annuities, we offer products that span accumulation, income, and investments. Our diverse suite of products, including pension risk transfer, stable value, structured settlements, and capital market offerings enable clients to meet their financial objectives and navigate risk.

 **Role Overview:**

  

We are seeking a dynamic and forward-thinking leader to lead an operations team in our Institutional Annuities (IA) Pension Risk Transfer (PRT) business in a hybrid role at our Jersey City location. The PRT team services group annuity contracts, which fund defined benefit pension plan obligations and works with annuitants and plan sponsors. Reporting to IA’s COO, and a member of IA’s Operations Leadership Team, the PRT Operations Manager drives service excellence and continuous improvement in support of IA’s growing PRT business.

  



**What You’ll Do:**

  

* Lead a team responsible for new business, retirement benefit calculations, in-force transactions, tax reporting, inbound contact servicing and death claims
* Help identify and coordinate technology enhancements to PRT administration systems and provide oversight for user acceptance testing
* Implement process enhancements and remove barriers to providing quality and timely service to our clients
* Handle the hiring, management, and development of a team of operations professionals
* Set team priorities to optimize service delivery and ensure client inquiries and requests are handled in accordance with departmental standards
* Promote a client focused orientation and an environment of collaboration and continuous improvement
* Identify issues impacting service delivery and, to ensure they don’t persist, develop action plans to remediate them
* Lead training and procedure reviews and updates
* Work with closely related areas, e.g., PRT New Business, Technology and Risk to coordinate work activities and improve efficiency

**What You’ll Bring:**

  

* Bachelor's Degree, business discipline preferred
* Strong leadership abilities: able to communicate objectives, influence without direct authority, delegate and motivate, and promote teamwork and efficient workflow
* Minimum of 3 years of experience managing a client services and/or operations area
* Understanding of pension risk transfer operations and/or income annuity operations preferred
* Experience leveraging and developing performance metrics
* Experience working on projects using Agile methodology a plus
* Excellent oral and written communication skills
* Strong Microsoft Excel and Word skills

 **This position primarily involves a hybrid work schedule - working remotely: Monday & Friday / on site: Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday.**

title: Izakaya Chef
description:
We are seeking a skilled Izakaya Chef to join our vibrant culinary team. The ideal candidate will have a passion for Japanese cuisine and a deep understanding of izakaya-style dining. You will be responsible for preparing and presenting a variety of dishes that reflect our commitment to quality and authenticity.

Key Responsibilities

* **Menu Development:** Create and innovate dishes that align with the izakaya concept, including small plates, grilled items, and seasonal specialties.
* **Food Preparation:** Prepare and cook a variety of dishes with attention to detail and presentation, ensuring consistency and quality.
* **Ingredient Management:** Source high-quality ingredients, manage inventory, and minimize waste while maintaining a clean and organized kitchen.
* **Team Collaboration:** Work closely with other kitchen staff to ensure smooth operations and a cohesive dining experience.
* **Customer Engagement:** Interact with guests to share knowledge about dishes and ingredients, enhancing their dining experience.
* **Health and Safety Compliance:** Adhere to food safety regulations and maintain a clean, safe working environment.

Qualifications

* **Experience:** Proven experience in Japanese cuisine, preferably in an izakaya or similar environment.
* **Culinary Skills:** Strong knowledge of traditional Japanese cooking techniques and flavor profiles.
* **Creativity:** Ability to create unique dishes and adapt to seasonal changes in ingredients.
* **Communication:** Strong interpersonal skills to collaborate with team members and engage with guests.
* **Passion for Food:** A genuine enthusiasm for Japanese culture and cuisine.

Benefits

* Competitive salary
* Opportunities for professional development
* Employee discounts
* Pay is negotiable, depending on experience

**To Apply:** Please submit your resume and a cover letter detailing your experience and passion for izakaya cuisine

Join us in creating memorable dining experiences that celebrate the spirit of izakaya!

description:

Join Plastic Express, Inc., a dynamic wholesale distribution company nestled in Union, New Jersey, catering to businesses across the bustling Tri-State area. Specializing in a vast array of products ranging from plastic bags to office supplies, janitorial essentials to hardware tools, we're the go-to solution for diverse business needs.

title: Warehouse Manager
description:
*Help us manage finished inventory and raw materials.*

Overview

Join our remote team at Ancient Crunch, the fastest-growing snack brand, as a full-time Warehouse Manager. You'll oversee our fulfillment and warehousing operations at the plant in Lebanon, NJ. This role is perfect for someone with substantial career experience managing inventory and shipments in a distribution center designed for both wholesale and e-commerce.

Responsibilities

We have grown quickly and at this point require professional oversight and best practices in the warehouse

* Ensure shipments are fulfilled correctly in a timely manner across three channels:
* E-commerce

* Setup and maintain an inventory tracking system

* Efficiently use space for inventory, packed boxes, palettes, etc.

title: Peer /Bridge Mentor
description:
Comunilife Inc. is looking for Peer /Bridge Mentors for its Harlem location. Assisting to promote recovery, re-housing, and coping skills among program participants by providing emotional support, companionship, and the benefit of their own experience with substance abuse, mental illness and/or homelessness, after undergoing peer mentor training. The Peer Mentors assist program participants manage recovery issues by promoting mental and physical health, sobriety or harm reduction, self-care, medication compliance, and in general, a better quality of life and independence. This position is part time up to 20 hours a week.

**Schedule:**

**Mon., Wed., Fri. 9:30am-4:30pm**

**Essential Functions:**

* Assist with the outreach, engagement, and acculturation of program participants struggling with issues of mental illness, homelessness, and substance abuse
* Provide crisis intervention services and supportive counseling within capability and training to assist participants to reduce/eliminate self-destructive behaviors;
* Assist in building up the esteem and self confidence of participants, by engaging them in activities of mutual interest, accompanying participants to view apartments, or to appointments to aide in obtaining entitlements
* Encourage participants to learn about and access specialized and natural community support
* Using Peer Mentor Training and other skills to assist participants to appreciate and attain better mental and physical health, sobriety or harm reduction, services to help them manage mental illness issues and strive to attain and maintain independent living.
* Assist clients in teaching/learning activities of daily living skills.
* Peer Mentors will collaborate with case management staff on the needs of the client.
* Conduct groups to promote socialization skills and promote recovery.
* Documentation of interaction.

**Education and Experience Requirement(s)**

High School Diploma/GED; bilingual (Spanish and English) is preferred. Personal experience in managing homelessness, substance abuse and/or mental illness. Ability to form interpersonal relationships with others and to be able to influence and persuade others in positive activities.

Comunilife is an EEO employer and provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

Job Type: Part-time

Expected hours: 20 per week

Benefits:

* Employee assistance program
* Flexible schedule

Schedule:

* Morning shift

Education:

* High school or equivalent (Required)

Experience:

* Peer Advocacy: 1 year (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Case Manager II
company: Mary Pomerantz Advertising for Catholic Charities of Brooklyn & Queens
description:
For over 125 years, Catholic Charities Brooklyn and Queens has been providing quality social services to the neighborhoods of Brooklyn and Queens, and currently offers 160-plus programs and services for children, youth, adults, seniors, and those struggling with mental illness.  
Our HomeBase Homelessness Prevention Programs provide services to those who are at risk of entering a shelter due to rental arrears, overcrowding or substandard housing, and to those who have a prior shelter history as part of aftercare services. Services may include case management, tenant/landlord mediation, advocacy/benefit entitlements, short-term financial assistance, referrals and varied workshops that can help individuals who are at risk of homelessness.

**STATEMENT OF THE JOB:**  
Under the direction of the Supervisor, the Case Manager II renders professional intervention to clients at risk of homelessness and homeless clients through comprehensive support services (assessment, intake, crisis intervention, information and referral, short and long-term comprehensive case management and financial assistance).

\\* Provide case management services, assessment and intake of participants to determine eligibility for services, including responding to telephone and walk-in inquires, conduct pre-screenings and provide brief and full services.  
\\* Provide and/or assure that each case assigned receives regular visits and contact as needed.  
\\* Establish and maintain case records including completing progress notes. Ensure all relevant case related information is inputted into case files and corresponding databases.  
\\* Assess the needs of the whole consumer/family including their basic needs such as food, clothing and shelter.  
\\* Follow-up on referrals you make on behalf of a consumer/family and respond to all referrals made to you/your program.

**QUALIFICATIONS:**  
\\* BS degree in Human Services or related field.  
\\* One Year experience in a social service setting or in providing direct services to individuals or families.  
\\* Bilingual skills (Spanish) a plus.  
\\* Ability to work flexible hours, including weekends, evenings according to the needs of program operation.  
\\* Able to conduct home/field visits and travel throughout the five boroughs as needed.  
\\* Frequently lifts and/or moves up to 10 pounds.

**BENEFITS:**

We offer a language differential to those fluent in Spanish to better serve the community.

In addition to competitive compensation, we offer excellent benefits:  
\\* Generous time off (Vacation Days/ + Personal Days/ + Sick Days/+ Paid Holidays annually)  
\\* Medical  
\\* Dental  
\\* Vision  
\\* Retirement Savings with Agency Match  
\\* Transit  
\\* Flexible Spending Account  
\\* Life insurance  
\\* Public Loan Forgiveness Qualified Employer  
\\* Training Series and other additional voluntary benefits.

For more information on our organization, please visit our website at:

www.ccbq.org EOE/AA.

title: Business Consultant, Realytix
description:
Business Consultant, Realytix
**Company**  

Munich Re America Services
  

**Location**  

New York , United States


We’re adding to our diverse team of experts and are looking to hire those who are committed to building a culture that enables the creation of innovative solutions for our business units and clients. We will consider a range of experience for this role and the offer will be commensurate with that.

 **The Company**


As a member of Munich Re's US operations, we offer the financial strength and stability that comes with being part of the world's preeminent insurance and reinsurance brand. Our risk experts work together to assemble the right mix of products and services to help our clients stay competitive – from traditional reinsurance coverages, to niche and specialty reinsurance and insurance products.


Realytix Zero has become one of the core pillars within Underwriting Technologies of Munich Re´s Digital Solutions P&C division. The business development especially is extremely strong and much more collaboration potential within Digital Solutions P&C will be leveraged going forward.

  

Realytix Zero is Munich Re´s cloud-based digital transaction platform for primary insurance companies, PI Brokers, MGAs and RI Brokers focusing on worldwide non-life standard business (new and existing products) and focusing on the “Rate-Quote-Bind” process. The platform helps reinsurance clients (insurance companies or RI brokers) to efficiently receive automatic MR reinsurance coverage within minutes instead of hours or days. Primary insurers (or MGAs) can use Realytix for being first mover in the market with new products or becoming a digital player with existing products to generate new business. The no-code/low-code platform (self-configurable) shall help clients to increase their (process) efficiency, to be flexible in a quickly changing market environment and to save costs. The strong API capabilities of Realytix Zero help to address all different kinds of distribution needs. With intelligent dashboards Realytix enables clients to analyze and monitor their portfolio and optimize tariffs.

 **The Opportunity**

**Future focused and always one step ahead**


Digital solutions and digital platforms are the key drivers for future growth. The Realytix Zero is a worldwide scalable Automated Underwriting Technology Platform comprising of rules and pricing engines to digitize & automate the underwriting of single risk business based on self-configuration for our business owners. The highly motivated team consists of colleagues with a broad range of know how – UW, IT Developers, Pricing experts, Actuaries, IT Platform Architects and Data Engineers and applies agile methodologies.

  

The Realytix team was built in the headquarter in Munich and has grown further internationally in US. The Business consultant is expected to assure high quality product implementation including analysis & reporting and support the execution of market strategies to fortify the overall product strategy in the NA region. This role will consult with our internal and external clients in the digitization of new or existing insurance or reinsurance products. The incumbent will support the business development and gather requirements for new platform features from the business and client perspective. The individual is expected to be able to influence technological platform developments and communicate those actively both internally and externally.

  



**Responsibilities:**

* Responsible for executing projects and delivering a superior client experience while managing the project pipeline
* Support in identifying new business opportunities with internal clients and external clients (Insurers, MGAs and Munich Re Group Companies) in order to digitize & automate the underwriting of new or existing insurance or reinsurance products. Engage with BD Manager in the development and delivery of tailored client value proposition. Prepare and support sales pitches alongside BD Managers.
* Consult proactively with the clients in the implementation and run phase to increase the volume of the business transacted exponentially
* Assist BD Manager in monitoring the success of sales strategy and derive insights from running implementations for enhancing and improving sales strategies.
* Understand the platform capabilities both from the business and technology perspective and contribute to the development of the platform
* Actively and regularly engage with members of the broader client teams (e.g. UW, actuarial, contract writers) to assist the BD in strategy execution, especially with the larger Americas Team. Regular engagement with cross platform, innovation, product developers, and experts in the wider Munich Re ecosystem to bring relevant ideas to the client team.
* Participate in client meetings, especially in connection with delivering the Munich Re value proposition and discussion of driving profitable growth in the relationship.
* Research topics relevant to the clients to deliver relevant thought leadership. Leverage external information and news to monitor market cycles and environment for areas of opportunity.
* Review and challenge feature requirements from a business perspective
* Broaden the understanding of Coding and IT Operations

 **Qualifications:**

* Understanding of underwriting principles in Non-life or Life (treaty or facultative) to understand product concepts for Automated Underwriting
* 5+ years of relevant experience in UW and project Management skills within the insurance or technology domains.
* Working knowledge and solid understanding of different insurance or reinsurance pricing approaches and components.
* Self starter with a strong bias for action and ability to manage competing priorities
* Excellent networking, communication, influencing without authority and stakeholder management skills
* Customer-service and relationship-oriented.
* Familiarity and interest with the technology space and IT platforms
* Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience preferred
* Willingness to work with teams distributed across different time zones and continents
* Willingness to travel around 10%

  

The role is being offered in New York, New York. The salary range posted below applies to the Company’s NYC location.

  

The base salary range anticipated for this position is **$** **110,500 - $162,000** plus opportunity for company bonus based upon a percentage of eligible pay. In addition, the company makes available a variety of benefits to employees, including health insurance coverage, an employee wellness program, life and disability insurance, 401k match, retirement savings plan, paid holidays and paid time off (PTO).

  



The salary estimate displayed represents the typical salary range for candidates hired in this position in NYC. Factors that may be used to determine your actual salary include your specific skills, how many years of experience you have and comparison to other employees already in this role. Most candidates will start in the bottom half of the range.

  



At Munich Re US, we see Diversity, Equity and Inclusion as a solution to the challenges and opportunities all around us. Our goal is to foster an inclusive culture and build a workforce that reflects the customers we serve and the communities in which we live and work. We strive to provide a workplace where all of our colleagues feel respected, valued and empowered to achieve their very best every day. We recruit and develop talent with a focus on providing our customers the most innovative products and services.  

  

We are an equal opportunity employer. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

  


Apply now!

title: Community Manager
description:
Hi, we're Fever  

We're excited you are checking out this job offer.

  


We are *the* leading global live-entertainment discovery tech platform with a clear mission: **to democratize access to culture and entertainment.**



How do we achieve our mission? Fever has developed a proprietary technology that inspires a global community of over 125M people through personalized and curated experiences in their local city whilst empowering entertainment and event creators to reach new audiences and enhance their experience.



Sounds amazing, right?

**About the Team**



Secret Media Network is a digital media group focused on recommending perfect plans, discovering great places, sharing things to do and relevant breaking news in different cities around the world. Our family is composed of Secret NYC, Secret Sydney, Secret LA, Secret Singapore, Secret Perth, Secret Tokyo, Secret Toronto, Secret London, Lisboa Secreta, Paris Secret, Madrid Secreto, Barcelona Secreta, and more!


**About the role**


* Collaborate with our Strategist team for a 360-degree perspective on Social Media.
* Conduct research, gather insights, test new tools, evaluate trends, and adapt practices accordingly.
* Develop comprehensive content proposals aligned with multichannel strategies, targeting diverse audience segments.
* Schedule and engage users with original, compelling copies.
* Contribute innovative ideas to enhance and manage our international communities on social media.
* Monitor and report on feedback and online reviews, collaborating with our Agents' team.
* Address complaints, provide timely solutions, and follow up for resolution.
* Set KPIs for our strategy, monitoring, tracking, analyzing, and reporting on social media platform performance.
* Build relationships with partners, customers, potential customers, industry professionals, and influencers.
* Promote collaboration across teams, markets, and departments for effective social media strategy execution.


**About you**


* Proficiency in both written and spoken English is essential; knowledge of other languages is a plus.
* Passionate about Digital Marketing, with a degree or equivalent experience focusing on digital portfolio projects.
* Excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication abilities.
* Proactive entrepreneur mindset with a proactive approach, ownership mentality, and effective team communication.
* Attention to detail, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills.
* Keeps abreast of digital technology and media trends, conducting ongoing research to understand their impact on Socials.
* Strong insight into factors driving online content popularity.
* Proficient in Canva, skilled in editing short-engaging videos; experience with design/editing tools like Photoshop, Illustrator, CapCut is a plus.
* Adaptable to the fast-paced environment of a digital startup business.
* Adept at identifying and tracking relevant community KPIs.
* Enjoys being part of a dynamic team in a growing company, collaborating effectively towards shared goals.
* Based in or willing to relocate to New York.


**Benefits & Perks**


* Attractive compensation package consisting of base salary 65k - 70k.
* Opportunity to have a real impact in a high-growth global category leader
* 40% discount on all Fever events and experiences
* Work in a location in the heart of New York City, with possible travel across our markets
* Health, Dental & Vision Insurance.
* Gympass (now Wellhub) membership
* 401k enrollment
* Responsibility from day one and professional and personal growth
* Great work environment with a young, international team of talented people to work with!


Thank you for considering joining Fever. We cannot wait to learn more about you!



If you want to learn more about us: Fever's Blog | Tech.Eu |TechCrunch



Fever is committed to creating an inclusive and diverse workspace where everyone's background and ideas count. Our main goal is to find the best possible talent regardless of place of birth, racial or ethnic origin, gender, gender identity, religion, opinion, sexual orientation, disability, pregnancy, marital status, age or caring responsibilities. We encourage everyone to apply!



If you require any kind of accommodation during the selection process please contact our Talent team so we can help you by providing a welcoming and seamless journey.

title: Aesthetic Registered Nurse
description:
Award-winning, professional and fast paced medical spa in Darien is seeking experienced registered nurse for cosmetic services. Experience with aesthetic medicine, injectables and lasers preferred, though willing to train the right candidate. Both part-time and full-time positions available with room for growth. Please send resume/CV as well as salary requirements.

**Position Overview:** We are seeking a skilled and compassionate Aesthetic Nurse to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in aesthetic treatments, excellent patient care skills, and a keen eye for detail.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Administer aesthetic treatments including injectables (Botox, dermal fillers), laser treatments, and skincare procedures.
* Conduct thorough consultations and assessments to understand patient goals and provide personalized treatment plans.
* Educate patients on procedures, expected outcomes, and post-care instructions.
* Maintain accurate patient records and ensure compliance with safety and regulatory standards.
* Collaborate with a team of healthcare professionals to deliver exceptional patient care.
* Stay updated on the latest trends and techniques in aesthetic medicine.

**Qualifications:**

* Current RN license in CT.
* Minimum 2 years of experience in aesthetic nursing or related field.
* Certification in injectables and laser treatments preferred.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment while maintaining a high level of care.

**What We Offer:**

* Competitive salary and benefits package.
* Opportunities for ongoing education and professional development.
* A supportive and collaborative work environment.

title: Manager, Planning
description:
**Job Description**  

We are looking to add a Manager, Media Planner to our team based in New York City, NY or remote working on a multinational consumer goods portfolio brand. You will join a team enthusiastic to support you and your career goals.


You will report to the Associate Director, Media Planner, and you, yourself, will manage 2 direct reports (1 Associate and 1 Senior Associate). You will help manage the daily tasks by assuring focus on important client goals and communicating appropriate resource needs to meet ongoing client goals. You will also get to demonstrate your working knowledge of the media space primarily TV, but also Radio, Print, and available media research and systems.

**Responsibilities:**

* Understanding of media channels and experience coordinating across multiple media disciplines
* 2+ years of media planning experience with TV (including Cost Outs, Media Math), Radio and Print
* Coordinate with creative on creative assets and accounts needs
* Coordinate with multi-channel teams to design modern, strategic and thoughtful integrated media plans across a myriad of channels
* Comfort overseeing and communicating directly with clients on questions and media plans
* Help evaluate timelines and manage daily deliverables
* Experience w/ analyzing competitive landscapes, pulling reports using agency tools and compiling insights
* Manage a large Media Budget and Flowchart
* Guide media channel selection and forward think on new opportunities
* Manage 1 Associate and 1 Sr. Associate - level team member on a daily basis

  

**Qualifications**  

* 2+ years of media planning experience
* 2+ years of media planning experience in TV (including Cost Outs, Media Math), Radio and Print
* 2+ years of experience with various media tools such as: Media Ocean, DDS, Nielsen Ad Intel, Pathmatics, Media Tools, Web Analytics, Ad Servers, Media Research tools
* Experience promoting collaborative relationships with other teams
* Comfortable working with budgets/numbers and an understanding of mathematical concepts
* Experience facilitating growth and managing and/ or mentoring / training multiple team members

**Desired, Not Required**

* Experience working on a large, portfolio brand
* Experience Managing 1+ junior teammates

  

**Additional Information**  

The anticipated salary range for this position is $62,400 - $83,375 Salary is based on a variety of factors including relevant experience, knowledge, skills, and other factors permitted by law. A range of medical, dental, vision, 401(k) matching, paid time off, and/or other benefits also are available. For more information regarding dentsu benefits, please visit www.dentsubenefitsplus.com.


#LI-EB1 #LI-Remote

**About dentsu**  

Dentsu is an integrated growth and transformation partner to the world’s leading organizations. Founded in 1901 in Tokyo, Japan, and now present in more than 110 markets, it has a proven track record of nurturing and developing innovations, combining the talents of its global network of leadership brands to develop impactful and integrated growth solutions for clients. Dentsu delivers end-to-end experience transformation (EX) by integrating its services across Media, CXM and Creative, while its business transformation (BX) mindset pushes the boundaries of transformation and sustainable growth for brands, people and society.


Dentsu, Innovating to Impact.


Find out more:  

https://www.dentsu.com/  

https://www.group.dentsu.com/en/


We are champions for meaningful progress and we strive to be a force for good—for our people, for our clients, for the industry and for our society. We keep our people at the center, creating space for growth, understanding and learning so they can thrive. We embed diversity, in our mindset, in our solutions and in our teams to empower an inclusive, equitable and culturally fluent environment. Building this culture within our teams makes us better collaborators with each other and with our clients, driving better outcomes for all.


Dentsu (the "Company") is committed to a policy of Equal Employment Opportunity and will not discriminate against an applicant or employee of the Company, on the basis of age, sex, sexual orientation, race, color, creed, religion, ethnicity, national origin, alienage or citizenship, disability, marital status, veteran or military status, genetic information, or any other legally-recognized protected basis under federal, state or local laws, regulations or ordinances. Applicants with disabilities may be entitled to reasonable accommodation under the terms of the Americans with Disabilities Act and/or certain state or local laws. A reasonable accommodation is a change in the way things are normally done that will ensure an equal employment opportunity without imposing an undue hardship on the Company. Please contact your recruiter if you need assistance completing any forms or to otherwise participate in the application process or to request or discuss an accommodation in connection with a job at the Company to which you are applying.

description:

title: Store Manager - Bayside
description:
**About Us:**



At Chip City, we bake joy daily! We specialize in creating ooey-gooey, freshly baked cookies and providing an exceptional customer experience. As a growing company, we are looking for passionate, energetic leaders to join our team.


**Job Summary:**



As the Store Manager at Chip City, you'll be the heartbeat of our cookie shop! You'll lead a team of awesome cookie enthusiasts, ensuring every customer leaves with a smile and a sweet treat. From overseeing daily operations to making sure our cookies are always fresh and delicious, you'll create a fun, welcoming environment where both customers and team members thrive. If you love cookies, people, and making a difference, this is the perfect role for you!


**Responsibilities:**


* Lead and inspire your amazing team of Counter Staff and Shift Leaders to achieve sales goals
* Recruit, hire, train, and mentor our new hires to ensure they perform at their best and follow our high company's standards
* Make sure every customer walks away happy, handling any questions or issues with care and kindness
* Supervise the baking process to ensure we follow the standard operating procedures and meet our high quality standards
* Take care of the numbers, including sales reporting, payroll, and making sure we stay on budget
* Oversee daily operations by handling staff schedules, payroll, ordering supplies, managing inventory, and making sure every customer gets top-notch service
* Ensure the store is sparkling clean, cozy, and follows all safety and food standards
* Regularly check equipment and work areas to keep things clean, safe, and up to our sanitation standards
* Create a positive, team-first atmosphere that's fun for everyone—both customers and employees


**Qualifications:**


* High school diploma or equivalent required
* 1+ years of retail or food service experience in a leadership or supervisory role
* Excellent leadership and communication skills, with the ability to effectively motivate and coach team members
* Ability to work efficiently in a fast-paced environment and adapt to changing priorities
* Detail-oriented with a focus on maintaining quality and consistency in product output
* Understanding of food safety regulations and willingness to enforce sanitation standards
* Food Protection Certification preferred or willingness to obtain (where required).
* Flexibility to work mornings, nights, weekends, and holidays as needed.
* Successful completion of on-the-job training.


**Physical Requirements:**


* Ability to navigate a bakery, stockroom, and office spaces, with the capability to lift up to 30 lbs., with or without reasonable accommodation.
* Capability to work in a commercial oven's high-temperature environment.
* Ability to withstand extended periods of standing.


**Benefits + Perks:**


* Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance plans
* Up to 10 days of Paid Time Off (PTO)
* 401(k) Retirement Plan
* Free shift cookie and beverage
* 50% Off employee discount
* Commuter benefits with pre-tax savings


**Pay Range:** $23.00 - $25.00 per hour
